column4: I'm connected to the internet fine but for some reason eth0 is not showing up as connected.
sure you don't have more than one ethernet? or wireless?
do you have anything suspicious is in /etc/network/interfaces ?? you might have it renamed perhaps?
I've got a box that acts as a firewall and I've renamed the interfaces to int0 and ext0
Everything looks ok to me. iface eth0 inet static
sounds like network-manager is just being goofy
well.. if gkrellm decies it's going to get info from network-manager (eg: via dbus).. that'd explain it
actually, is dbus working properly? (no idea off the top of my head how to check.. but it seems the logical place to check next)
yeah I didn't see it either.. oops!
ugh. yuk. very yuk. oh well, least you know it works at least. Was this the default user on the machine from install, or a new one?
cool.. I ask simply because I thought perhaps the user wasn't added to a necessary group to do this sort of stuff.
